title: Uppercase Names from JSON Array
description: Extract names from a JSON array and return them in uppercase.
prompt:
Data: JSON array of objects
Task: return the names in uppercase
code:
const obj = JSON.parse(data);
return obj.map(x => x.name.toUpperCase());

title: Filter CSV by Age or City
description: Return names of people older than 30 or living in Berlin from a CSV.
prompt:
Data: CSV with columns first name, last name,age, city
Task: return only the names of people older than 30 as a JSON array or living in Berlin

title: HTML List of People with Age from CSV
description: Create an HTML bullet list of people with their age from a CSV.
prompt:
I have a data set with people that looks like this: First Name,Last Name,Birth Date,City Elijah,Lopez,1992-06-20,Houston Olivia,Rodriguez,1986-04-11,Philadelphia Elijah,Davis,1993-07-01,San Jose Can you generate Javascript that processes this data and create an HTML bullet list that a concatenation of first name and last name with their age between parentheses, like:
  • Elijah Lopez (33)
  • Olivia Rodriguez(39)
Only generate the JavaScript - nothing else.
data:
First Name,Last Name,Birth Date,City
Elijah,Lopez,1992-06-20,Houston
Olivia,Rodriguez,1986-04-11,Philadelphia
Elijah,Davis,1993-07-01,San Jose

title: Random Dutch Names
description: Generate a list of 50 random popular Dutch names for boys and girls.
prompt: generate JavaScript for creating a list of 50 random popular Dutch names for boys and girls

title: Deduplicate CSV
description: Remove duplicate records from a CSV data set - by keeping only the first record with a specific value for the name field
prompt:
You are a code assistant. 
I will provide you with:
- The input data (as a string, which may be CSV, JSON, or plain text).
- The transformation or processing I want done.

Write a single JavaScript function body that:
- Accepts one argument called `data` (string).
- Processes it according to my request.
- Returns the result (object, array, or string).

Important:
- Do not include explanations or comments.
- Do not include markdown formatting or triple backticks.
- The output must be **only valid JavaScript code** for the function body.

Example input:
Data: JSON array of objects
Task: return the names in uppercase

Desired Example Output:
const obj = JSON.parse(data);
return obj.map(x => x.name.toUpperCase());


Now here is my request:
Data: [name,city,#employees,revenue,industry,year of founding
Acme,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998
Globex Inc.,San Francisco,800,250M,Finance,2005
Tyrell Corporation,Los Angeles,2200,1.2B,Manufacturing,1985
Stark Industries,Chicago,5000,5.5B,Aerospace,1969
Tyrell Corporation,Gotham,1200,800M,Real Estate,1939
Omni Consumer Products,Detroit,900,350M,Retail,1978
Tyrell Corporation,Seattle,3500,2.1B,Biotechnology,2010
Acme,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998]

Task: [deduplicate these records based on the name field]
data:
name,city,#employees,revenue,industry,year of founding
Acme,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998
Globex Inc.,San Francisco,800,250M,Finance,2005
Tyrell Corporation,Los Angeles,2200,1.2B,Manufacturing,1985
Stark Industries,Chicago,5000,5.5B,Aerospace,1969
Tyrell Corporation,Gotham,1200,800M,Real Estate,1939
Omni Consumer Products,Detroit,900,350M,Retail,1978
Tyrell Corporation,Seattle,3500,2.1B,Biotechnology,2010
Acme,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998
output:
name,city,#employees,revenue,industry,year of founding
Acme,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998
Globex Inc.,San Francisco,800,250M,Finance,2005
Tyrell Corporation,Los Angeles,2200,1.2B,Manufacturing,1985
Stark Industries,Chicago,5000,5.5B,Aerospace,1969
Omni Consumer Products,Detroit,900,350M,Retail,1978

title: Sort CSV data by any field
description: Take a CSV data set. Add an asterisk to the field you want to sort by. Run the JS code to have the data sorted by that field
prompt:
You are a code assistant. 

I will provide you with:

- The input data (as a string, which may be CSV, JSON, or plain text).

- The transformation or processing I want done.



Write a single JavaScript function body that:

- Accepts one argument called `data` (string).

- Processes it according to my request.

- Returns the result (object, array, or string).



Important:

- Do not include explanations or comments.

- Do not include markdown formatting or triple backticks.

- The output must be **only valid JavaScript code** for the function body.



Example input:

Data: JSON array of objects

Task: return the names in uppercase



Desired Example Output:

const obj = JSON.parse(data);

return obj.map(x => x.name.toUpperCase());





Now here is my request:

Data: 

name,city,#employees,revenue,industry*,year of founding

Acme Corporation,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998

Globex Inc.,San Francisco,800,250M,Finance,2005

Cyberdyne Systems,Los Angeles,2200,1.2B,Manufacturing,1985

Stark Industries,Chicago,5000,5.5B,Aerospace,1969

Wayne Enterprises,Gotham,1200,800M,Real Estate,1939

Omni Consumer Products,Detroit,900,350M,Retail,1978

Tyrell Corporation,Seattle,3500,2.1B,Biotechnology,2010

Dunder Mifflin,Scranton,50,15M,Paper,1980

Initech,Dallas,300,90M,Software,1995

Weyland-Yutani Corp,London,4500,3.8B,Logistics,2001

Gekko & Co.,Miami,100,50M,Investment,2012

Pied Piper,Palo Alto,75,25M,Technology,2014

Hooli,Mountain View,1800,900M,Technology,2007

Massive Dynamic,Boston,2500,1.5B,Science,1990

Soylent Corporation,Sacramento,400,120M,Food,20



Task: 

Find the field with an asterisk at the end and sort the data by that field. If the field contains numerical values, then sort from minimum to maximum, otherwise sort alphabetically. Return the data in the same CSV format. Move the sort field to the front.
data:
name,city,#employees,revenue,industry,year of founding*
Acme Corporation,New York,1500,500M,Technology,1998
Globex Inc.,San Francisco,800,250M,Finance,2005

Hooli,Mountain View,1800,900M,Technology,2007

Umbrella Corporation,Raccoon City,2000,1.8B,Pharmaceuticals,1999

Monsters Inc.,Monstropolis,700,450M,Energy,2006
Gen-Pop,Austin,150,75M,Marketing,2018

title: Sudoku Solver
description: With a Sudoku in a simple form: 9x9 grid, periods or digits as starting point
prompt:
You are a code assistant. 

I will provide you with:

- The input data (as a string, which may be CSV, JSON, or plain text).

- The transformation or processing I want done.



Write a single JavaScript function body that:

- Accepts one argument called `data` (string).

- Processes it according to my request.

- Returns the result (object, array, or string).



Important:

- Do not include explanations or comments.

- Do not include markdown formatting or triple backticks.

- The output must be **only valid JavaScript code** for the function body.



Example input:

Data: JSON array of objects

Task: return the names in uppercase



Desired Example Output:

const obj = JSON.parse(data);

return obj.map(x => x.name.toUpperCase());





Now here is my request:

Data - a Sudoku in a 9x9 grid:

53..7....

6..195...

.98....6.

8...6...3

4..8.3..1

7...2...6

.6....28.

...419..5

....8..79



Task: [generate the JavaScript to complete the Sudoku - determine which digits go int the place of the periods]
